page.title: 20CLITHEROE'S CLIMATIC SAYINGS
page.content:
The damp climate of Clitheroe was an important factor in establishing the cotton industry of the town. Even today old sayings about the weather are still to be heard. Most of these make reference to Pendle Hill which can be seen to the east of the town. "When Pendle wears its woolly cap, Farmers all must take a nap."
"When Pendle Hill doth wear a hood, Be sure, the day will not be good."
"If you can't see Pendle, it's raining, If you can see Pendle, it's going to rain." Times have not changed. June of this year has been cool and cloudy, with rain and showers occurring on about half the days.
